title.narrative: PREVENTION, IDENTIFICATION AND REPORTING

description.narrative: Government, communities and civil society capacity to work on prevention, identification and reporting of child abuse, violence and exploitation and provision of appropriate care strengthened, especially for vulnerable groups.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government, communities and civil society capacity to work on prevention, identification and reporting of child abuse, violence and exploitation and provision of appropriate care strengthened, especially for vulnerable groups.

description.narrative: To strengthen the technical capacity of government and civil society in the prevention and care of vulnerable families, the work conditions of the public social workers, as well as their skills and those of social workers of others public institutions continued to be improved through training. The establishment of an internship program to support the Department of social Protection is in due course. The various actors of child protection have been informed and trained on the new child protection legislation and the new Family Law that came into force at the beginning of 2019. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:29/01/2020

title.narrative: Number of functioning child protection systems offering preventive and response services in regions supported by UNICEF

Number of Professionals working in regions supported by UNICEF and in contact with children trained to prevent, identify, report and respond to child protection cases as per existing laws and policies
Number of professionals in contact with children trained to prevent, identify, report and respond to child protection cases as per existing laws and policies
Number of districts having Police, Family and Juvenile Protecting Units operating according to child and women friendly guidelines
Number of children and adults that have access to a safe and accessible channel to report sexual exploitation and abuse [COVIDSitRep]
Availability of new procedures and services for children in contact with law are applied and delivered in line with international norms

Country has a functioning, national, multi-sectoral, multi-stakeholder coordination mechanism tasked with overseeing national plans or strategies to prevent and respond to violence against children and adolescents, with child and adolescent participation
Country has an inter-operable information management system supports and tracks case management, incident monitoring, and programme monitoring (all, including humanitarian)
Country has an interoperable service delivery with Health
